alert.note: Alert for Colorado (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 1:59PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Colorado County through 230 PM CDT... At 159 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Weimar, or 7 miles southeast of Schulenburg, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus and Weimar. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
